messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/api.php`, I found that `App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\UserController@show` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/v1/users/{user}`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/api.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\UserController@show`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

{'stdout': './app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController.php:13:class UserController extends Controller
./app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php:13:class UserController extends Controller
./app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php:12:class UserController extends Controller
', 'stderr': ''}

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Possible file containing the Api\V1\UserController@show handler:
- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php

Explanation:
- The App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\UserController class defines the show(User $user): UserResource method, which returns a UserResource wrapping the given User. This is the actual implementation of the show handler for the route GET /v1/users/{user} as wired in routes/api.php (within the v1 group, using UserController). The file also contains other methods (index and update), but the show method is the one implementing the App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\UserController@show handler. There are other UserController files in different namespaces (Admin and root), but they are not implementations of Api\V1\UserController@show.
